basic_info.title: Aave Protocol
basic_info.tagline: The Leading Decentralized Lending and Borrowing Protocol
basic_info.description: Aave is an open-source and non-custodial liquidity protocol for earning interest on deposits and borrowing assets. It supports multiple blockchains and offers innovative features like flash loans, allowing users to access liquidity instantly without collateral.

founders.name: Stani Kulechov
founders.bio: Founder of Aave (formerly ETHLend). Law student from Finland who started Aave in 2017. Previously built ETHLend. Deep expertise in DeFi and blockchain governance.

product.description: Aave is a fully functional decentralized lending protocol deployed on multiple chains including Ethereum, Polygon, Avalanche, and Arbitrum. Key features include: (1) Lending and borrowing with variable and stable interest rates, (2) Flash loans - uncollateralized loans that must be returned within one transaction, (3) Liquidity mining rewards, (4) Cross-chain functionality, (5) Governance by AAVE token holders.

market.target: Crypto users seeking to earn yield on deposits or borrow assets without centralized intermediaries. Target segments include: DeFi traders, liquidity providers, institutions seeking yield, developers building on Aave
market.market_size: DeFi lending market estimated at $50B+ TVL globally

tokenomics.vesting: Team and investor tokens had 3-year vesting (now fully vested). Token also used for staking in Safety Module to protect protocol.

extracted_text: Aave is a decentralized non-custodial liquidity market protocol where users can participate as suppliers or borrowers. Suppliers provide liquidity to the market to earn a passive income, while borrowers are able to borrow in an overcollateralized (perpetually) or undercollateralized (one-block liquidity) fashion. The protocol has been audited and secured. The Aave Protocol is maintained and upgraded by the decentralized Aave governance system. AAVE token holders collectively act as governors of the protocol.
